trial_identification.studytitle: A Pharmacokinetics Study of the Effects of GSK2118436 on Warfarin, the Effects of Ketoconazole and Gemfibrozil on GSK2118436, and the Effects of Repeat Doses of GSK2118436 in Subjects With BRAF Mutant Solid Tumors
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Four-Part, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Effects of Repeat Dose GSK2118436 on the Single Dose Pharmacokinetics of Warfarin and the Effects of Repeat Dose Oral Ketoconazole and Oral Gemfibrozil on the Repeat Dose Pharmacokinetics of GSK2118436, and the Repeat Dose Pharmacokinetics of GSK2118436 in Subjects With BRAF Mutant Solid Tumors

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Warfarin Treatment: drugs - Ketoconazole Treatment: drugs - Gemfibrozil Treatment: drugs - GSK2118436 150mg Treatment: drugs - GSK2118436 75mg
Experimental: Part A - Warfarin dosed at 15mg
Experimental: Part B - Ketoconazole dosed at 400mg
Experimental: Part C - Gemfibrozil dosed at 600mg
Experimental: Part D - GSK2118436 dosed alone
Treatment: drugs: Warfarin Warfarin dosed at 15mg on Day 1 and Day 22
Treatment: drugs: Ketoconazole Ketoconazole dosed at 400mg daily on Days 19 through 22
Treatment: drugs: Gemfibrozil Gemfibrozil dosed at 600mg twice daily on Days 19 through 22
Treatment: drugs: GSK2118436 150mg GSK2118436 dosed at 150mg twice daily
Treatment: drugs: GSK2118436 75mg GSK2118436 dosed at 75mg twice daily

primaryOutcome.outcome: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of S-warfarin with and without GSK2118436
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 168 hours after dosing on Day 1 (warfarin alone) and Day 22 (warfarin in combination with GSK2118436)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC) of S-warfarin with and without GSK2118436
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 168 hours after dosing on Day 1 (warfarin alone) and Day 22 (warfarin in combination with GSK2118436)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of GSK2118436 with and without an inhibitor
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18 (GSK2118436 alone) and Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC) of GSK2118436 with and without an inhibitor
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to12 hours after dosing on Day 18 (GSK2118436 alone) and Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Cmax of GSK2118436 and metabolites after single and multiple 75mg HPMC dose
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1 and up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18

primaryOutcome.outcome: AUC of GSK2118436 and metabolites after single and multiple 75mg HPMC dose
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1 and up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time to Cmax (Tmax) of GSK2118436 and metabolites after single and multiple 75mg HPMC dose
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1 and up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18

primaryOutcome.outcome: Half-life of GSK2118436 and metabolites after single 75mg HPMC dose
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1 and up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1 and up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18

primaryOutcome.outcome: Half-life of GSK2118436 and metabolites after single 150mg HPMC dose
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 24 hours after dosing on Day 1

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cmax of R-warfarin with and without GSK2118436
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 168 hours after dosing on Day 1 (warfarin alone) and Day 22 (warfarin in combination with GSK2118436)
Up to 168 hours after dosing on Day 1 (warfarin alone) and Day 22 (warfarin in combination with GSK2118436)
Up to168 hours after dosing on Day 22

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of subjects with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From date of first dose to transition to Rollover protocol BRF114144 (22 - 29 days) or study follow up visit if subject does not transition to BRF114144 (approximately 29 - 39 days)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Tmax for GSK2118436 with and without an inhibitor
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18 (GSK2118436 alone) and Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: AUC, Cmax, Tmax and trough concentration of GSK2118436 metabolites with and without an inhibitor, and AUC ratio of metabolites to parent
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18 (GSK2118436 alone) and Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Inhibitor concentrations in combination with GSK2118436
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to12 hours after dosing on Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: AUC of R-warfarin with and without GSK2118436
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 168 hours after dosing on Day 1 (warfarin alone) and Day 22 (warfarin in combination with GSK2118436)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Up to 12 hours after dosing on Day 18 (GSK2118436 alone) and Day 22 (GSK2118436 in combination with inhibitor)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: GSK2118436 is an orally administered, potent and selective small molecule BRAF inhibitor that is being developed for the treatment of BRAF mutation-positive tumors. This is a 4-part study (in 4 separate cohorts of subjects) designed to examine the interaction potential of GSK2118436, either as a perpetrator (i.e., effect of GSK2118436 on warfarin; Part A) or victim (i.e., effect of other drugs on GSK2118436; Part B: ketoconazole and Part C: gemfibrozil), as well as to evaluate the single and repeat dose pharmacokinetic parameters of GSK2118436 (Part D). A sufficient number of subjects will be screened to obtain approximately 12 evaluable subjects each for Part A, Part B, Part C and Part D. Following completion of this study, subjects may continue dosing with GSK2118436 in the roll-over study, Protocol BRF114144.
